results.title: Running high: a story of pain and joy ...
results.creator_credit: Gus Howard and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Novices and champions prepare for, and run the 1983 Festival City Marathon. Robert de Castella intersperses candid interviews with his marathon running philosophy and techniques. Discusses the exhilaration of personal improvement, the disappointment of hitting the wall and the reasons behind the increasing popularity of running throughout the world.

results.title: Eager to write: Lorraine Wilson
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scollo and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: Dicusses the ways in which children learn to write and how children who find writing difficult can be encouraged and taught. Features many of the ideas of Lorraine Wilson.
results.description: Dicusses the ways in which children learn to write and how children who find writing difficult can be encouraged and taught. Features many of the ideas of Lorraine Wilson.

results.title: Sweet sixteen and pregnant
results.creator_credit: John Cosgrove, Ann Hassett and Dave Bell Associates
results.brief_description: Provides case studies of teeage pregnancies looking at the outcome for each girl when it was discovered that she was pregnant. Considers adoption, abortion, keeping the child, and living with one’s family. Highlights the enormous stress of being a teenage mother and points out that girls should fight peer group pressure to have sexual relationships if they do not wish to do so.

results.title: City girls
results.brief_description: Shows a bushwalking and outdoors activities program at the Mittagundy camp on the Bogong High Plains attended by unemployed girls from underprivileged backgrounds and girls of the same age from private school backgrounds. Notes in particular the way in which the girls respond to the various challenges of the camp.

results.title: Reading together
results.creator_credit: Jenni Taplin and Latrobe University. School of Education. Media Centre
results.brief_description: Looks at the program being conducted at Reservoir East Primary School in which parents of children in infant grades are being encouraged to read with their children in order to facilitate the reading process. Show techniques that can used to stimulate reading. Narrated by Jeni Taplin. No other credits available.

results.title: What's the difference!
results.creator_credit: Priscilla M. Clarke, Sally Abbott-Smith, Free Kindergarten Union Multicultural Resource Centre and Maude Media
results.brief_description: Examines the role of multicultural education in early childhood development programs. Explains that multicultural education is nesessary for all children and that it should be an overall agenda, incorporated into all aspects of early childhood development education.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Priscilla M. Clarke, Sally Abbott-Smith, Free Kindergarten Union Multicultural Resource Centre and Maude Media

results.title: The Transition tapes
results.brief_description: These tapes are intended to aid the Transition Education evaluation process by raising relevant questions and issues. They enable re-assessment of attitudes to learning and resources, employment and unemployment from five viewpoints : student, teacher, community, employer and school administrator. No other credits available.

results.title: Planning for school effectiveness: program budgeting
results.brief_description: Explains school-based program budgeting using detailed examples of the highly effective approach at Rosebery District High School, Tasmania. Considers policy making and planning community and staff involvement, management of conflict, building consensus, and evaluation. No other credits available.

results.title: Equal opportunity tapes
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Cockram and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Emphasises the importance of equal opportunity to both male and female teachers. Tape 1. Introduces and defines the concept of equal opportunity. 2. Designed to show what the real world is about for women. 3. Attempts to encourage teachers to examine, analyse and consider altering their classroom practice.

results.title: Different sort of system
results.brief_description: Looks at an alternative form of education at the Benedict Community school in New South Wales that is designed to meet the needs of school leavers who are unable to cope with the traditional school system. The course aims to encourage the development of the students as individuals and prepares them for their transition into the workforce.
